title: Classic Fashion Magazines
description: How well do you remember the glossy fashion magazines that shaped American style for decades?

questions.question: Which fashion magazine, known as 'the fashion bible,' has been published continuously since 1892?
questions.explanation: Vogue, first published in 1892, became the world's most influential fashion magazine, setting trends and showcasing designers for over a century.

questions.question: Which women's magazine, featuring patterns and homemaking advice, was essential reading for home seamstresses in the 1950s?
questions.explanation: McCall's magazine was famous for its McCall's sewing patterns and fashion content, making it essential reading for the millions of women who sewed their own clothes.

questions.question: Which teen fashion magazine, launched in 1954, told young women 'what to wear, what to read, what to think'?
questions.explanation: Seventeen magazine, launched in 1944, became the definitive teen fashion and lifestyle magazine, guiding young women on fashion, beauty, and social issues.

questions.question: Which magazine, first published in 1867, is the oldest continuously published fashion magazine in the world?
questions.explanation: Harper's Bazaar, first published in 1867, is the oldest fashion magazine still in publication, known for its sophisticated fashion coverage and artistic photography.

questions.question: Which magazine transformed from a general women's publication into a bold feminist and fashion magazine under Helen Gurley Brown in 1965?
questions.explanation: Cosmopolitan was transformed by editor Helen Gurley Brown starting in 1965, becoming a groundbreaking magazine for modern, independent women.

questions.question: Which magazine was known for its 'Good Housekeeping Seal of Approval' that guaranteed product quality?
questions.explanation: Good Housekeeping's Seal of Approval, introduced in 1909, became a trusted symbol of product quality that consumers relied on when making purchases.

questions.question: Which sewing pattern company published a popular magazine that was essentially a catalog of their latest fashion patterns?
questions.explanation: Vogue Patterns (a division of Vogue magazine) published pattern catalogs and magazines that brought high-fashion designs to home seamstresses.

questions.question: Which fashion magazine targeted at young career women was known for its annual 'Glamour Do's and Don'ts' feature?
questions.explanation: Glamour magazine's 'Do's and Don'ts' street-style feature, showing real women's fashion hits and misses, became one of the most popular regular features in any magazine.

questions.question: What was the primary way women learned about the latest fashion trends before television became widespread?
questions.explanation: Fashion magazines were the primary source of style information for most American women, bringing runway trends and celebrity fashion to readers across the country.

questions.question: Which mail-order catalog functioned as both a shopping resource and a fashion guide for rural American women?
questions.explanation: The Sears, Roebuck catalog served as both a shopping lifeline and fashion guide for rural women, showing them the latest styles available for mail order.

questions.question: Which iconic Vogue editor-in-chief, known for her short silver bob, led the magazine from 1971 to 1988?
questions.explanation: Grace Mirabella led Vogue from 1971 to 1988, modernizing the magazine to reflect the changing times and more practical approach to fashion.

questions.question: Which legendary Vogue editor, known for her flamboyant style, popularized the phrase 'Why don't you...' in her columns?
questions.explanation: Diana Vreeland, editor of Vogue from 1963 to 1971, was known for her outrageous 'Why Don't You...' suggestions and her transformative influence on fashion.

questions.question: What service did many women's magazines offer in the 1950s that allowed readers to order dress patterns by mail?
questions.explanation: Women's magazines featured dress designs with corresponding mail-order patterns, allowing home sewers to recreate fashionable looks at a fraction of store prices.

questions.question: Which women's magazine had the famous tagline 'Never Underestimate the Power of a Woman'?
questions.explanation: Ladies' Home Journal used the tagline 'Never Underestimate the Power of a Woman' in its advertising, positioning itself as a magazine that respected women's influence.

questions.question: What type of special magazine issue, published every September, became the biggest fashion event of the publishing year?
questions.explanation: The September issue of fashion magazines, especially Vogue, became the most important issue of the year, previewing fall fashion trends and packed with advertising.
